== Downloading Ubuntu GNOME ==

<<BR>>

=== Checklist ===

# Please, '''BACKUP''' your important data before anything else as Ubuntu GNOME will not do it for you automatically.
# Download the ISO file for the desired release. Take into account the default "Desktop" installer requires at least 1 GB of RAM.
# Check <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/HowToMD5SUM | MD5SUM]]</nowiki> for the downloaded ISO - You will need to compare your MD5SUM with <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UbuntuHashes | Ubuntu Hashes]]</nowiki>. This is to make sure your file is correct and safe to use.
# <nowiki>[[BurningIsoHowto | Burn]]</nowiki> the DVD (ISO size is above 700MB) or create a bootable USB flash drive - using <nowiki>[[http://unetbootin.sourceforge.net/ | UNetbootin]]</nowiki> is highly recommended.
# Check USB or DVD Disc for Errors.  When you boot the default installer, you will see the option to "Check Disc For Errors".
# Please do read The Release Notes '''before''' downloading Ubuntu GNOME.
# If you have a PC with the Windows 8 logo or UEFI firmware, choose the 64-bit download <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/UEFI | Read More]]</nowiki>.

=== Torrent ===

Please use the <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/BitTorrent | torrent link]]</nowiki> to download, it will be a faster download and will save on costs for bandwidth for the Canonical servers which means more money in the budget for all of the Ubuntu flavours. Please, seed as much as possible to help others as well.

=== Try without Installation ===
If you are not sure about installing Ubuntu GNOME, you can try it out <nowiki>[[http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Live_CD | without affecting]]</nowiki> your current installed system.Hint:  With the default DVD, you can boot your computer with Ubuntu GNOME to <nowiki>[[http://www.howtogeek.com/howto/windows-vista/use-ubuntu-live-cd-to-backup-files-from-your-dead-windows-computer/ |back-up your data]]</nowiki>!

~+'''PC 32 bit'''+~<<BR>>
'''32-bit version''', suitable for almost all PCs. Choose this if unsure.

~+'''PC 64 bit'''+~<<BR>>
'''64 bit version''' for Intel or AMD computers. Most PCs older than about 2007 are not 64-bit compatible, so you may need a 32-bit ISO instead of a 64-bit ISO. Usually, if you have 4GB RAM and more, you will need to use this version.
